alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 10:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Florence, north central Georgetown, southwestern Horry, southwestern Marion and northeastern Williamsburg Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1024 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brittons Neck, or 15 miles south of Marion, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Johnsonville, Hemingway, Dongola, Outland, Gresham, Pee Dee Crossroads, Poston, Brittons Neck, Kingsburg, Bucksport, Aynor and Stuckey. This includes SC Highway 22 near mile marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Horry; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg
